results.title: The management of work centres for the handicapped
results.creator_credit: Michael Holmes, Francis Haveron, Heron Film Productions and United Motion Pictures
results.brief_description: Describes the process of management through the management committee, the work centre manager and his staff. It shows work produced by physically handicapped workers which includes packing, assembling wire products, various machine operations and handicrafts.

results.title: The Man from East Liverpool: Ben Feldman
results.creator_credit: Jay J. Sheridan and Jay J Sheridan and Company
results.brief_description: Instructional film on salesmanship and setting goals for yourself. Uses Insurance salesman Ben Feldman as the focus. He gives a background of himself and how he got to where he is today. He is shown in action conducting sales in real scenarios demonstrating the attitudes needed to achieve personal success.

results.title: The Man and the snake
results.creator_credit: Sture Rydman, Elizabeth McKay and Jocelyn Films
results.brief_description: Presents a story of a young man’s visit to the home of a zoologist who keeps and studies snakes. Based on the story of the same title by ambrose Bierce. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: The Mammalian story: the beginning of life (Japan)
results.creator_credit: Jun-Ichiro Takeda, Cine-science and Rokuro Hayashi
results.brief_description: Examines the development of the mammal. Considers aspects of cell division and the nature of chromosomes and heredity. Looks in detail at the reproductive organs of the male and female, fertilization and the growth of the embryo. This film makes excellent use of photomicrography to record development of the embryo. Narrated by Brian McInerney.

results.title: The Mallet = Malj (D)
results.brief_description: In a futuristic antiseptic food factory, workers select healthy chicks while the rejects are carried along a conveyor belt until they are crushed by a mallet and dropped into a garbage bin. A single black chick appears among the yellow and is shoved toward the garbage bin. Before the mallet strikes the gasping chick rebels. A terrifying vision of Social Darwinism, rendered as a haunting and powerful allegory. Without narration. Winner of the 1979 Melbourne Film Festival short film competition. NB: CONTAINS DISTURBING IMAGES

results.title: The Making of the river [B&W]
results.brief_description: Shows how a river forms from many sources: the clouds, melting snow in the mountains and underground springs. It flows throufh canyons and forests, making waterfalls and sometimes quiet pools. Also shows plant and animal life it passes on the journey to the sea, gathering water from joining streams.

results.title: The Making of a live television show
results.brief_description: Production of a live television show, from the first meeting of the writers to the dance rehearsal, to the final performance. Shows the pressure on the director and points out that a television presentation requires much pre-planning and work. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: The Making of 'Silent Running'
results.creator_credit: Chuck Barbee, Thomas Piskura and Chuck Barbee Productions
results.brief_description: Presents a behind-the-scenes look at the people and technology needed to produce the film “Silent running”. Gives a close look at the work of director Douglas Trumbull, star Bruce Dern, singer Joan Baez, the editor, cameraman and others. Suitable for upper secondary level.
